sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Cutter Mill for size reduction of pharmaceutical materials using cutting and shearing action to produce uniform particle size.
sections.scope: Applicable to milling and size reduction activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the cutter mill is installed on a stable foundation with proper safety guards.
Verify that all electrical connections and interlocks are functioning properly.
Check that the cutting blades and screen are clean and properly installed.
Select appropriate screen size based on desired particle size output.
Inspect cutting blades for sharpness and replace if worn or damaged.
Power ON the cutter mill and allow it to run empty briefly.
Listen for any unusual noise or vibration indicating improper assembly.
Prepare the material to be milled ensuring it is dry and free from foreign matter.
Start feeding material through the hopper at a controlled rate.
Monitor the feed rate to prevent overloading the mill.
Observe the motor load and adjust feed rate if necessary.
Collect milled material in appropriate containers at the discharge.
Check particle size of milled material periodically.
If required, pass material through mill again for finer size reduction.
Monitor temperature of milled material if heat-sensitive ingredients are processed.
After completion, stop the feed and allow mill to run until empty.
Power OFF the mill and wait for complete cessation of rotation.
Remove screen and blades for cleaning and inspection.
Clean all product contact parts thoroughly with brush or vacuum.
Reassemble the mill after cleaning for next operation.
Document milling parameters, screen size, and material details in the batch record.
precautions: Never operate the mill without proper safety guards in place.
Do not insert hands or objects into the mill during operation.
Avoid overloading which can damage blades or motor.
Replace worn or damaged blades immediately for consistent milling.
Use appropriate screen size to prevent clogging or over-milling.
Monitor motor temperature to prevent overheating.
Wear hearing protection as cutter mills generate significant noise.
Wear appropriate PPE including safety goggles, dust mask, and gloves.
Ensure proper dust extraction to maintain clean environment.
Follow lockout/tagout procedures during cleaning and maintenance.
